name: Subasish Das, Ph.D.
label: Director, AIT Lab
description: Dr. Subasish Das is an Assistant Professor of Civil Engineering Program in the Ingram School of Engineering at Texas State University. He is also involved with Texas A&M Transportation  Institute (TTI) as a part time Associate Research Scientist. Previously, he worked as a full-time Associate Research Scientist at TTI during 2015 to 2022. He has more than 13 years of experience related to roadway safety, traffic operation, and connected and automated vehicle (CAV) technologies. He is a Systems Engineer by training with hands on experience on Six Sigma and Lean Engineering. His major areas of expertise include database management, statistical analysis and machine learning with emphasis in safety and transportation operations, spatial analysis with modern web GIS tools, interactive data visualization, and deep learning tools for CAV technologies. Dr. Das is a prolific author. He has published more than 160 technical reports, and journal articles. He is the author of the book “Artificial Intelligence in Highway Safety,” which was published by CRC Press in 2022. The AASHTO Research Advisory Committee (RAC) awarded one of his research reports as 2014 AASHTO Sweet Sixteen High Value Research Project. Dr. Das is an active member of ITE, and ASCE. He is an Eno Fellow. He served as vice-president of membership of Young Professionals in Transportation Houston chapter. He is currently a member of three TRB Committees: Information and Knowledge Management (AJE45), Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Computing Applications (AED50), and Impairment in Transportation (ACS50).

name: Jinli Liu, Ph.D.
label: Post-doctoral Researcher (Jan 2025-Current), Ph.D. Student (2023-2024)
description: Jinli Liu is a Ph.D. Candidate in the Geographic Information Science Program in the Department of Geography & Environmental Studies at Texas State University, under the supervision of Dr. Das. She joined the AIT Lab in Fall 2022 and worked as a Doctoral Research Assistant. She holds an M.S. in Transportation Management & Planning from Texas Southern University (2021) and a bachelor's degree, along with an additional master's degree, from Zhejiang Normal University in China. Jinli's research focuses on traffic safety analysis, GIS-based data conflation, spatial analysis, traffic signal design, operational analysis, and the integration of machine learning in transportation studies.
awards: The Bernard W. Detlefsen Doctoral Candidate Scholarship, $1,000 (2024)

name: David A. Mills
label: Ph.D. Candidate, Geographic Information Science (Fall 2022 - Current)
description: David A. Mills is a geospatial data analyst and software developer. He is a PhD Candidate in Geographic Information Science at Texas State University. David has been working for Dr. Das in the AIT Lab since 2022. David specializes in discovering and improving the understanding spatio-temporal phenomena. He builds pioneering smart technologies and leverages them using advanced geocomputational techniques. David is a former non-commissioned officer of the United States Army who developed cultural awareness, mechanical skills, and honed effective leadership while stationed in South Korea, Germany, and Afghanistan. He is detail-oriented, focused, and self-driven. David is a published researcher, a frequenter of scientific conferences, and an avid smart-technology enthusiast. He is committed to the task of promoting environmental and public safety awareness while improving communities through the application of leading-edge technologies and geospatial analysis.
awards: Dwight D. Eisenhower Transportation Fellowship Program, $7,000 (2022)
NSF I-Corps Interior Northeast Winter 2024 Cohort, $50,000 (2024)

name: Shriyank Somvanshi
label: Ph.D. Candidate, MSEC (Fall 2023 – Current)
description: Shriyank Somvanshi is a Ph.D. student and doctoral assistant at Texas State University. His research focuses on applying deep learning models, including Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), explainable AI techniques such as SHapley Additive exPlanations (SHAP), and Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) to enhance data analysis and model accuracy. Shriyank holds a Master of Science in Civil Engineering from Texas State University and a Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering from Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technical University, India.
awards: Scholarly Travel Activity and Research (S.T.A.R.) Grant, $300 (2024)

name: Mahmuda Sultana Mimi
label: M.Sc., Civil Engineering (Fall 2023 - Current)
description: Mahmuda is currently pursuing Master's in Civil Engineering at Texas State University under the supervision of Dr. Subasish Das. She joined AIT lab in Fall 2023 as a Graduate Research Assistant. Previously, she earned her Bachelor's degree in Urban and Regional Planning from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET). Her research focuses on transportation safety, encompassing vulnerable road users, driver behavior, and micromobility; as well as travel behavior and demand modeling. She is deeply engaged in developing Machine Learning, and Deep Learning based models; Statistical and Econometric models; GIS based spatial data analysis; and data mining in the field of transportation. In addition to her academic pursuits, she serves as the secretary of the ITE TXST chapter, where she supports initiatives to enhance transportation systems and promote safety.

name: Syed Aaqib Javed
label: M.Sc., Civil Engineering (Fall 2023 – Current)
description: Syed Aaqib Javed is a Master's student in Civil Engineering, specializing in Transportation Engineering at Texas State University (TXST). He has been working as a graduate research assistant at the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation (AIT) Lab under the supervision of Dr. Subasish Das since Fall 2023. Prior to joining TXST, he worked as a faculty member at Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology (AUST) in Dhaka, Bangladesh. He completed his B.Sc. in Civil Engineering at AUST. His research interests include transportation safety, transportation system planning, and travel behavior analysis. In addition to his academic work, he is an active member of the TXST-ITE student chapter, where he contributes to projects aimed at optimizing transportation infrastructure and promoting safety initiatives.

name: Rohit Chakraborty
label: M.Sc., Civil Engineering (Fall 2023 – Current)
description: Rohit is currently a MS student in the Civil Engineering Program at Texas State University, advised by Dr. Das. He joined the AIT Lab in Fall 2023 and works as a graduate research assistant. Previously, Rohit completed his B.S. in Civil Engineering from Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology, Bangladesh. Rohit is interested in data mining applications in transportation safety and operations. His research expertise also includes traffic simulation, transportation modeling, and driving behavior analysis. Rohit enjoys cooking, cycling, and listening music.
awards: Scholarly Travel Activity and Research (S.T.A.R.) Grant, $450 (2024)

name: Swastika Barua
label: M.Sc., Civil Engineering (Fall 2023 - Current)
description: Swastika Barua is pursuing her Master's in Civil Engineering at Texas State University, under the supervision of Dr. Subasish Das. She joined the AIT Lab in Fall 2023 and currently working as a Graduate Research Assistant. Swastika obtained her Bachelor's degree from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Bangladesh. Her research focuses on traffic safety and driver behavior analysis, with a specialization in classical statistical methods and machine learning techniques. Beyond her academic endeavors, Swastika actively participates in the TXST-ITE student chapter, contributing to initiatives aimed at enhancing transportation systems and safety.
awards: Scholarly Travel Activity and Research (S.T.A.R.) Grant, $450 (2024)

name: Anannya Ghosh Tusti
label: M.Sc., Civil Engineering (Fall 2024 - Current)
description: Anannya has completed her bachelor's degree from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET) in 2023. As a Research Assistant at BUET, she utilized spatial and statistical analysis expertise on some impactful projects in Bangladesh. She is currently pursuing her master's at Texas State University as a Graduate Research Assistant in the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation Lab. Anannya's research in AIT Lab is focused on transportation safety, crash risk assessment, and driver behavior analysis through machine learning and GIS-based techniques. As Project Coordinator in the Institute of Transportation Engineers (ITE) at Texas State University, Anannya Ghosh Tusti leads the planning and implementation of specific projects, coordinating teams, schedules, and resources to meet objectives, while monitoring progress, addressing issues, and reporting status updates to the executive team and members. Beyond her academic pursuits, Anannya is passionate about community service, actively volunteering with the Lions Club of Dhaka Rose Garden. In her free time, she loves to paint and listen to music, having practiced classical music for many years, which nurtured a profound appreciation for its cultural significance. An environmental enthusiast at heart, she is dedicated to integrating sustainability into her work, aiming to create a lasting, positive impact on the world.

name: Md Monzurul Islam
label: M.Sc., Civil Engineering (Fall 2024 – Current)
description: Md Monzurul Islam is a Master's student in Civil Engineering (Transportation) at Texas State University, where he works as a Graduate Research Assistant under the supervision of Dr. Subasish Das. He brings a diverse academic and professional background, holding a Master's degree in Architecture from the University of Tokyo and a Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology. Monzurul's research focuses on transportation safety, crash risk assessment, and driver behavior analysis, utilizing machine learning, statistical models, and GIS-based spatial analysis. He is also proficient in building R-based tools for quick visualization and decision-making. In addition to his research, Monzurul has extensive experience in software development, project management, and structural engineering. As Vice President of Outreach for the Institute of Transportation Engineers (TXST Chapter), Monzurul develops and implements strategies for community engagement, builds relationships with external organizations, alumni, and potential sponsors, organizes promotional events, and manages outreach and recruitment efforts to attract new members. Monzurul also enjoys tinkering with a wide variety of tools and technologies, always curious to explore and experiment with everything he encounters—in his words, 'I like to play with everything.'

name: Sazzad Bin Bashar Polock
label: M.Sc., Civil Engineering (Fall 2024 – Current)
description: Sazzad Bin Bashar Polock is a Master's student in Civil Engineering (Transportation) at Texas State University, working under the guidance of Dr. Subasish Das. Currently working as a graduate instructional assistant at the Ingram School of Engineering, he joined the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation (AIT) lab in Fall 2024. His research interests include traffic safety, crash data analysis, driver behavior, and the integration of autonomous vehicles within existing infrastructure. He earned his bachelor's degree in civil engineering from Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology in 2023.

name: Tausif Islam Chowdhury
label: M.Sc., Civil Engineering (Spring 2025 – Current)
description: Tausif Islam Chowdhury is a Master's student in Civil Engineering (Transportation) at Texas State University, working under the guidance of Dr. Subasish Das. Currently serving as a Graduate Instructional Assistant at the Ingram School of Engineering. He joined the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation (AIT) Lab in Spring 2025. His research interests include transportation safety, infrastructure resilience, artificial intelligence applications in transportation, and sustainable urban mobility. He earned his bachelor's degree in Building Engineering and Construction Management from Khulna University of Engineering & Technology (KUET) in 2023. Tausif enjoys exploring emerging technologies, data science techniques, and creatively solving complex problems, while also having a passion for video games, cricket, and football.

name: Darrell Anderson
label: B.Sc., Civil Engineering (Fall 2023 - Current)
description: Darrell is a senior at Texas State University, majoring in Civil Engineering (CE) and minoring in mathematics. In the summer of 2023, Darrell started working as an undergraduate research assistant at the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation (AIT) lab under Dr. Das Subasish. While at AIT, Darrell was awarded the Dwight David Eisenhower Transportation Fellowship (DDETFP), which he presented at DC on the concept of 15-minute cities. As a member of a few engineering and environmental groups, Darrell is passionate about the environment and water resources, and he is interested in the impact that urbanization, along with the increase in traffic systems, has on the environment. As a civil drafter/designer for a small urban planning and development company, he has helped design many sites currently under development. As a founding member of the Institute of Transportation Engineers – at Texas State University, he holds the treasurer position. In his free time, he enjoys cooking, baking, and reading and is working towards becoming a sommelier in his free time.
awards: Dwight D. Eisenhower Transportation Fellowship Program (DDETFP), $8,500 (2023)
Dwight D. Eisenhower Transportation Fellowship Program (DDETFP), $7,000 (2024)

name: Biplov Pandey
label: B.Sc., Civil Engineering (Fall 2024 - Current)
description: Biplov is currently an undergraduate student in the Civil Engineering Program at Texas State University, guided by Dr. Das. He joined the AIT Lab in Fall 2024 and works as an undergraduate research assistant. Originally from Nepal, Biplov is interested in transportation engineering and infrastructure development. His research focus includes transportation safety and sustainability. He has prior experience as a Surveying Assistant at SadaShiva Infra Private Limited, where he contributed to site assessments and data collection for mapping and project planning. Biplov's projects include geological field studies and detailed surveying tasks with proficiency in total stations, theodolites, CAD software, SolidWorks, and Microsoft Office. Outside of academics, Biplov enjoys watching cricket, playing table tennis, and hiking.

name: Teale Robison
label: B.Sc., Urban and Regional Planning (Fall 2021- Current)
description: Teale is currently a senior at Texas State University, majoring in Urban and Regional Planning and minoring in Geographic Information Systems (GIS). She started at the Artificial Intelligence in Transportation (AIT) lab in fall 2024 and is currently working as an undergraduate research assistant for Dr. Das. Teale is passionate about the environment and sustainable development, especially involving transportation and creating a more efficient system. She has prior experience working as a Visual Analytics intern at Texas A&M Transportation Institute (TTI) utilizing GIS and ArcPy. Involved in several campus activities such as the Student Urban Planning Organization (SUPO) and SWIG (Supporting Women in Geography). In her free time, Teale enjoys playing board games, reading, and paddleboarding.
awards: Bernard W. Detlefsen Junior Academic and Leadership Scholarship, $1,500 (2024)

name: Gaurab Chhetri
label: B.Sc., Computer Science (Fall 2024 - Current)
description: Gaurab is currently an undergraduate student in the Computer Science Program at Texas State University. He joined the AIT Lab in Fall 2024 and works as an undergraduate research assistant for Dr. Das. Originally from Nepal, Gaurab is passionate about web development and IT operations, with a strong focus on creating responsive and user-friendly web applications. His technical expertise spans HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Tailwind, Node.js, Express, MongoDB, and MySQL, along with version control using Git and GitHub. Before joining Texas State, Gaurab worked as an IT Officer, where he managed domain registrations, email systems, and computer lab environments. He also has experience in digital marketing, social media management, and graphic design, providing a holistic approach to enhancing online presence for businesses. His hands-on experience extends to WordPress, PHP, SQL, and a variety of tools that streamline IT operations and web development.'
awards: Best In Coding at Hackacat Nano by ACM AI @ TXST (2024)
